intro: Paronychia insularum, commonly known as the island buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and simple, palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous areas. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Paronychia insularum is often found in open habitats and can be a common sight in Mediterranean gardens and natural reserves.
